channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: 5 Essential Ryobi Tools to Supercharge Your DIY Projects
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Unlock your DIY potential with these must-have Ryobi tools. From sawzalls to impact drivers, top off your toolbox.
item.content:encoded: Finding the right tool for the job can sometimes be a challenge, but once you do, it'll level up your DIY game and make even the most difficult projects easier. If you've just bought into the Ryobi ecosystem, or are considering it, here are five must-have Ryobi tools.

item.title: Best Movie Years Ever: 1982—Genre Films Rein Supreme
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: This was the monumental year that gave us classics like E.T., Blade Runner, and Conan the Barbarian.
item.content:encoded: 1982 was a fantastic year for genre film lovers. There was plenty of sci-fi and fantasy for all ages, ranging from violent revenge in the time of sorcery to charming alien adventures fit for the family. Whether it was swords or spaceships, there was something for you.

item.title: Rip Nova Launcher, Pixel 10 Reviews, Google Photos Features: Android This Week
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: Android news, editorials, and more from the last 7 days.
item.content:encoded: It was a particularly interesting week in the Android world. One of the oldest and most beloved apps by long-time Android users was put out to pasture. We also reviewed both the Pixel 10 Pro and Pixel 10. And some Google apps got some new goodies.

item.title: 3 Things I Still Refuse to Go Digital On
item.dc:creator: Jordan Gloor
item.description: I might be a terminally-online computer geek, but about some things I'm an analog holdout.
item.content:encoded: Despite how my job and hobbies mostly revolve around the digital world, even I have my limits. It may well be 2025, but I still refuse to throw my money into the "modern" digital versions of certain products.

item.title: Why This $20K Hybrid Is the Smartest Used Buy Right Now
item.dc:creator: Adam Gray
item.description: This no-frills Japanese hybrid quietly delivers the best bang for your $20K budget.
item.content:encoded: Hybrids are having a moment, and it’s not hard to see why. They’re more efficient, punchier to drive, and no longer carry the steep premium they once did.

item.title: Linux vs. Windows: Why Linux Will Gain Ground in the Desktop War
item.dc:creator: Graeme Peacock
item.description: Forget all the other years; this year will be the year of the Linux desktop.
item.content:encoded: The year of the Linux desktop may be a bit of a joke, but switching to Linux is not. You've either done it at some point, or you're probably considering it. Linux is quickly improving, while Windows is increasingly becoming hostile. I've outlined four ways that Linux will gain ground on Windows.

item.title: Plex's Security Breach, New iPhones, Visual Studio Updates, and More: News Roundup
item.dc:creator: Corbin Davenport
item.description: All the news you might have missed from the last week.
item.content:encoded: This was another busy week in tech news, with Apple's September event, IFA wrapping up, Plex reporting a security breach, and a lot more. Here are the biggest stories you might have missed.

item.title: These Buds Come With All the Specs but Don't Cost All the Money
item.dc:creator: Bertel King
item.description: Why pay a lot when you don't have to?
item.content:encoded: The JLab JBuds Pods ANC are affordable buds with excellent battery life and a svelte carrying case. They check off the spec wishlist, but that doesn't quite mean they're up to par with more premium buds.

item.title: Adult Swim's Disturbing Infomercials: A Surreal Nightmare
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Setting a trap for late-night cable watchers.
item.content:encoded: Cartoon Network's "Adult Swim" programming block gave us so much groundbreaking TV, and we're still feeling the effects of it today, as creators who got their big break with Adult Swim moved on to create other iconic media.

item.title: 9 Massive Laptops That Redefine "Portability"
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: Imagine lugging around a 30-pound 'laptop' with no battery. These early portable computers were more like anchors than mobile devices, but they paved the way for today's notebooks.
item.content:encoded: Even the biggest, heaviest laptop I own—a 17-inch workstation monster— can still easily fit in a backpack with enough room left for snacks. But over the course of portable computing history, there have been some computers that really stretch the definition of "mobile".
